info.name: SFHacks2026(20260214)-CRS-Sandbox
info.description: Postman collection for SFHacks2026's CRS products. Use this to test your features in our Sandbox environment before we move you to Production.

item.name: User Utilities

request.description: Will login user and allow access to user endpoints given the correct credientials in the request payload. Returns a user JWT token (utoken) that will need to be passed as a header to each user endpoint. This sandbox contains a script to update utoken headers automatically when this request is sent.

request.description: Utility endpoint to retireve all the CRS Error Codes and descriptions of what each one means.

response.name: OK

request.description: Retreives a log of each requested report. The user can view which reports came from cache and which were pulled.
Given a RequestID from a previous report this endpoint retrevies that report from CRS's secure database. CRS will store each requested report for 7 years per bureau regulations.
Given a Request ID from a previous PDF request this endpoint retrevies that PDF report from CRS's secure database. CRS will store each requested report for 7 years per bureau regulations.

item.description:
# SF Hacks Overview: #### [SF Hacks Full OpenAPI Spec](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/pVFfBdy94jxq) - Above is a complete OpenAPI spec for the products we have provided to all hackers - You can use this to generate an implemtaion or view data definitions. - There is additional documentation for each product that can be found in the corresponding request folder in this collection. **All of the below products are accessed through the CRS API.** - Authentication uses a login request to obtain a Bearer token and Refresh token. - The Sandbox environment supports only the predefined test identities. - When moving to **production**, CRS will provide new credentials and a new host URL. - No testing is permitted in the live environment, so be sure to limit your testing to the sandbox environment. **This Sandbox environment replicates production behavior, so please limit all testing to the sandbox to avoid unintended production inquiries.** ## Start Here! Run the sample request labeled, "User Login", to obtain a Bearer token to authorize use of each endpoint. ### Auth and platform utilities for:
  • JWT tokens
  • user info
  • errors
  • logs
  • retention
  • cache invalidation

item.name: CIC Reports
item.description:
The CIC Reports API supports both Eviction and Criminal report types using a shared endpoint pattern. Specify `{report}` as either eviction or criminal depending on which report you are requesting.

### **Step 1: Order Report**

**POST**

**`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{report}/new-request`**

- Returns a JSON CIC report for the identity submitted in the request body.
    
- The response includes a `RequestID` header — capture this value for the next step
    
- To apply **tenant screening regulation filtering**, include `"propertyZip"` with the ZIP code of the property being applied for.
    

### **Step 2: Generate PDF Report**

**GET**

**`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{report}/new-pdf-request/{RequestID}`**

- Returns a PDF version of the report from Step 1.
    
- Use the same `{config}` and `RequestID` values.
    
- Wait about **200 ms** after Step 1 before calling Step 2 to ensure data is available.
    
- Request the PDF within **24 hours** to ensure a single inquiry.
    

### **Inquiry Review Scenarios**

In certain inquiry attempts, manual intervention by CIC may be required to update a record or permit order fulfillment.

When this occurs, you’ll receive a response similar to the following:

``` json
{
  "orderResponse": {
    "message": "This applicant cannot be conducted through the automated system at this time. Please contact Customer Service.",
    "responseID": "91919191",
    "name": "SMITH,KEVIN"
  }
}

 ```

This message indicates that CIC must manually review or update the record — typically due to local tenant-screening regulations affecting items in the report.  
Our system reaches out to CIC to have them update the file in these cases. Once CIC completes the update, you can retrieve the finalized report using the **get-response** endpoint.

### **Step 3: Retrieve Updated Report**

**GET****`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{report}/get-response/{responseID}`**

- Use the `responseID` from Step 1.
    
- You may **poll this endpoint** periodically until the updated data becomes available.
    

#### Field Documentation

- [CIC Eviction Report Data Definitions (PDF)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/yCMBICtVjd/CIC_Eviction_Report_Data_Definitions.pdf_)
    
- [Test Cases – CIC Eviction Report (TXT)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/N3gqh9MpxL/Testcases_-_CIC_Eviction_Report.txt_)
    
- [CIC Criminal Report Data Definitions (PDF)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/RHm029W55x/CIC_Criminal_Report_Data_Definitions.pdf_)
    
- [Test Cases – CIC Criminal Report (TXT)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/IrDXscci4Z/Testcases_-_CIC_Criminal_Report.txt_)

item.name: Consumer Credit Report
item.description:
### **Step 1: Order Credit Report**

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{bureau}/credit-report/standard/{config}`

- Returns a JSON credit report in the **CRS Standard Format**.
    
- The `{config}` and `{bureau}` parameters are preconfigured for your sandbox account (examples are included in this Postman Collection).
    
- The `{config}` parameter defines which report configuration to use (set up by CRS).
    
- The response includes a `RequestID` header — capture this value for the next step.
    

### **Step 2: Generate PDF Credit Report**

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{bureau}/standard-credit-report/pdf/{config}/{RequestID}`

- Returns a PDF version of the report from Step 1.
    
- Use the same `{config}` and `RequestID` values.
    
- Wait about **200 ms** after Step 1 before calling Step 2 to ensure data is available.
    
- Request the PDF within **24 hours** to ensure a single inquiry.
    

### **Step 3: Retrieve an Existing Credit Report**

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com/api/{bureau}/credit-report/standard/{config}/{RequestID}`

- Retrieves an existing JSON report.
    

#### Field Documentation

- [CRS Standard Format – Quick Start Guide (PDF)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/L5BXx4P6S2/CRS_Standard_Format_-_Quick_Start_Guide.pdf_)
    
- [CRS Standard Format – OpenAPI Specification (YAML)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/mQCWozdHSv/crs_standard_format_complete.yaml_)
    
- [CRS Standard Format – Test Cases (TXT)](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/zpUNy1kG04/CRS_API_Standard_Format_Testcases.txt_)

item.name: Consumer Flex ID
item.description:
# Overview:

LexisNexis® FlexID is an identity verification service that surfaces authoritative, data‑driven checks on a consumer’s personally identifiable information (PII). It is designed to help your business approve more applicants on the first attempt, reduce abandonment in digital onboarding flows, and support fraud and compliance controls without adding unnecessary friction.

#### **Step 1:** Order LexisNexis Consumer Flex ID

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com:443/api/flex-id/flex-id`

- This endpoint returns a JSON LexisNexis Consumer Flex ID report based on the identity submitted in the request body.
    

#### Documentation:

- [LexisNexis FlexID Documentation](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/69KWb4dj4Vcd)

item.name: Fraud Finder
item.description:
### **Step 1:** Order Fraud Finder Report

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com:443/api/fraud-finder/fraud-finder`

- This endpoint returns a JSON Fraud Finder report for the identity submitted in the request body.
    

### **Step 2:** Order Fraud Finder PDF Report

**POST**

`https://api-sandbox.stitchcredit.com:443/api/fraud-finder/pdf/{RequestID}`

- This endpoint returns a PDF Fraud Finder report for the order in step 1
    
- The `RequestID` for a report can be found in the response headers for a order in step 1
    
- Use the `RequestID` in the URL to generate a PDF of the report that is associated with that `RequestID`
    
- Send this request within 24 hours of receiving the JSON Fraud Finder report to ensure this flow results in a single inquiry
    

#### Documentation:

- [CRS Fraud Finder Overview.pdf](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/HgcJxxrTCJYk)
    
- [CRS_Fraud_Finder_OpenAPI_Spec.yml](https://crsgroupinc.egnyte.com/dl/qfWDcQrXbRGg)
